title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw:
The DRC vehicle can't make sharp turns.  Note that this is a separate issue from [#176](#!/osrf/drcsim/issue/176/drc-vehicle-responds-very-slowly-in-drcsim) in which changes since drcsim 2.3 caused the vehicle to be unresponsive.  Even before the changes which made the vehicle unresponsive, it couldn't make sharp turns and had an unrealistically shallow turn radius.  

When driving at full speed this is not an issue since you don't need to do sharp turns and if you could it's likely that the vehicle would flip. However, if you are close to an obstacle and need to do a controlled two points turn it becomes a serious issue.  Instead of doing short controlled turns you end up moving virtually straight forwards and backwards, making little progress. When that happens, the odds of you going off course or hitting the obstacle that you're trying to avoid increase significantly.

My suggestion would be to increase the amount of torque it applies while turning.  This could cause the vehicle to flip over at speed, but is also easily avoided by just not applying the maximum steering angle. Which is how vehicles behave in the real-world.
